title: Constantine
review: I don't normally have that issue with quiet dialogue in modern films, that other people complain about. I like the dynamic range of movies generally, but I'm sure that everyone in this talks in intentionally soft and sometimes mumbling voices. Keanu is kind of like a Sam Spade type of noir detective, with dry wit and personal baggage. I thought the world was interesting in an American Gods kind of way. Some of the CGI set-pieces were a bit lame, and relatively loud.
